abstract: Eighty-six percent of adults said they had shopped at a supermarket in the last month down from 93 percent in 2005, and stores like Wal-Mart have benefited.
snippet: Eighty-six percent of adults said they had shopped at a supermarket in the last month down from 93 percent in 2005, and stores like Wal-Mart have benefited.
lead_paragraph: The percentage of adult food shoppers who said they had shopped at a supermarket over the last month has fallen from to 86 percent from 93 percent since 2005, according to “U.S. Grocery Shopper Trends,” a survey of customers’ behavior prepared yearly by the Food Marketing Institute, a trade group.
